intro: Myosotis patula, commonly known as the European forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Myosotis patula is also cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
